text: Miles per hour is a unit of measurement. It measures speed. It is the number of miles moved in an hour. Miles per hour is the unit used for speed limits on roads in the United Kingdom (UK) and the United States (US). It is normally abbreviated in everyday use to mph. In technical publications, it is sometimes abbreviated as mi/h. The SI unit for velocity is m·s−1 (metres per second). ==Conversions== 1 mph equals: * 0.44704 m·s−1, the SI derived unit * 1.609344 km·h−1 * 22/15 =1.4667 feet per second * ~0.868976 knots Category:Imperial units Category:Units of velocity
title: Miles per hour
